title: Aeneid 2 594-603 - Venus to raging Aeneas - Set 2

content.question: "Nate, quis indomitas tantus dolor excitat iras? Quid furis? Aut quonam nostri tibi cura recessit? Non prius aspicies ubi fessum aetate parentem liqueris Anchisen, superet coniunxne Creusa 5Ascaniusque puer? Quos omnes undique Graiae circum errant acies et, ni mea cura resistat, iam flammae tulerint inimicus et hauserit ensis. Non tibi Tyndaridis facies invisa Lacaenae culpatusve Paris, divum inclementia, divum 10has evertit opes sternitque a culmine Troiam." Aeneid 2. 594-603 Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question. 1. In lines 1-5 (Nate . . . puer), (A) identify two second person verbs and (B) translate them in context. 2. In lines 1-5 (Nate . . . puer), which three Latin words can be translated as “your concern for us”? 3. In lines 1-5 (Nate . . . puer), (A) identify the one present tense subjunctive verb and (B) explain why it is in the subjunctive mood. 4. In lines 1-5 (Nate . . . puer), which two Latin words indicate that Aeneas’ father is very old? 5. To what three things or people in this passage does Quos (line 5) refer? 6. In lines 5-10 (Quos . . . Troiam), which three Latin words can be translated “the enemy sword would have drained”? 7. (A) Identify one and only one literary device found in line 8 (Non . . . Lacaenae) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it. 8. (A) What are the case and number of opes (line 10) and (B) which Latin word modifies it? 9. Earlier in Book 2, (A) what specific Greek warrior shows a violent rage similar to Aeneas’ towards Helen? (B) Whom does that warrior kill in Book 2 ?

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
